title: 'They stole surname of Gujarati': PM mocks Gandhis, takes failed 'start-up' jab at Rahul
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi sharply criticised the Congress and the Gandhi family in the Rajya Sabha, accusing them of being "habitual thieves" and alleging they stole Mahatma Gandhi's surname. He also targeted Rahul Gandhi, calling him "Yuvraj" and criticizing his "traitor" remark against a Sikh MP, which he deemed an insult to Sikhs and the community's sacrifices.

title: Tamil Nadu elections: How BJP plans to do a Bihar in state and will it be enough?
content: The BJP is attempting to replicate its Bihar electoral strategy in Tamil Nadu by consolidating opposition forces and forming a broad social alliance across major caste segments. Aiming to counter the DMK, the party is forging alliances with former partners and breakaway factions, including the AIADMK and PMK, to build a wider NDA for the upcoming assembly elections.

title: Beyond the tricolour: Indian-origin captains at the T20 World Cup 2026
content: As India co-hosts the T20 World Cup 2026, several associate nations will feature captains of Indian origin, adding a unique narrative. Players like Monank Patel (USA), Dilpreet Bajwa (Canada), and Jatinder Singh (Oman) lead their teams, showcasing the global reach of cricket and their ambition to challenge established powers on the world stage.

title: Google CEO thinks Bloodbath in markets worldwide in reaction to Anthropic’s AI tool is overblown
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Nvidia's Jensen Huang dismiss market panic over AI plugins, calling it overblown.  Anthropic's new tools, particularly for legal tasks, triggered significant stock drops.  Pichai views AI as an enabling tool, while Huang argues it will enhance, not replace, existing software, urging a focus on core competencies.

title: Five years, 10 states: Where India’s government school count fell the most
content: Lok Sabha data shows that India’s government school count has declined over the past five years, but the fall is neither even nor gradual. It is concentrated in a handful of states and often arrives in sharp, single-year corrections. The numbers point to administrative change more than a uniform national trend, raising questions about how the official school map is being reshaped locally.

title: Dell sued by 5 ex-employees; complaint alleges that the company mismanaged its 401(k) plan
content: Five ex-Dell employees are suing the tech giant, alleging its 401(k) plan mismanagement cost workers over $318 million. The lawsuit claims Dell violated federal law by keeping workers in underperforming investment funds while profiting from its own products.  This class action seeks to recover losses and reform the retirement plan's operations.

title: 'I eat 2kg of gaalis daily': In light moment during RS speech, PM Modi reveals 'health secret'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi delivered a strong speech in Rajya Sabha criticising the Congress for decades of misgovernance and alleged deep hatred towards him. Modi also targeted Rahul Gandhi's recent comments, calling them an insult to Sikhs. The Prime Minister stated that much of the NDA's work involves correcting past mistakes.

title: OpenAI sees exit of senior-level employees after CEO makes it compulsory to use ChatGPT
content: OpenAI is experiencing a significant exodus of senior researchers as CEO Sam Altman prioritizes ChatGPT development over long-term AI exploration.  Key figures, including a VP of research, have departed due to resource allocation disputes, with experimental projects reportedly sidelined.  This strategic shift, driven by intense competition, leaves some teams feeling marginalized and questioning their original research goals.

title: ‘Conflict nearing end’: Centre, Nagaland and ENPO sign FNTA agreement — what it means
content: The Central government, Nagaland government, and ENPO have signed an agreement to establish the Frontier Nagaland Territorial Authority (FNTA) to address the demands of Eastern Nagaland. Union Home Minister Amit Shah stated the MHA will fund the new body and ensure development in the region, marking progress towards peace and development in the Northeast.

title: What exactly is a laminate? 6 things to know about it
content: Laminates are more than just a surface finish. They are engineered material systems that define how interiors perform and last. Modern laminates offer advanced durability, hygiene, and safety features. They adapt to changing design trends and lifestyles. This makes them a practical and reliable choice for homes and commercial spaces. Laminates are also increasingly made with sustainability in mind.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo turns 41: Career goals, records, achievements and net worth
content: Cristiano Ronaldo, a global football icon, continues to defy age with his unparalleled goalscoring prowess and relentless ambition.  Now 41, he boasts 961 career goals and a trophy-laden career, with the FIFA World Cup still a dream.  Beyond the pitch, his commercial empire solidifies his status as a sporting billionaire, proving his hunger for greatness remains undimmed.

title: 'Asked PM not to come to House': LS Speaker says plot by Cong MPs to create 'inappropriate incident'
content: Lok Sabha was adjourned amid security concerns over alleged Congress plans to attack Prime Minister Narendra Modi, despite his presence. Opposition rejected the claims, accusing the government of stalling proceedings. The Prime Minister is expected to address the Rajya Sabha later.

title: After IPL exclusion, Lahore Qalandars sign Bangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman for PSL
content: Lahore Qalandars have secured Bangladesh fast bowler Mustafizur Rahman for the 2026 Pakistan Super League season. Rahman, a former Qalandar, returns to the franchise after a stint with Kolkata Knight Riders in the IPL. His signing comes after recent developments involving the IPL and Bangladesh cricket.

title: Govinda’s manager denies bankruptcy rumours, says debts are cleared
content: Govinda's manager Shashi Sinha has strongly refuted claims of the actor's financial distress and marital problems. Sinha clarified that Govinda remains in demand for films and events, receiving numerous offers from top industry figures. A significant project is expected to be announced soon.

title: T20 World Cup: 'Humari flight book hai Colombo ki' - India captain Surya on Pakistan clash
content: India captain Suryakumar Yadav confirmed the team will head to Colombo for their T20 World Cup match against Pakistan, despite uncertainty.  Pakistan's Salman Ali Agha stated their participation hinges on government directives, with the Pakistani government having previously announced a boycott of the February 15th fixture.

title: 'Bizarre thing...': Shashi Tharoor reacts to son Ishan being sacked by Washington Post
content: Reacting on X, Tharoor wrote: “The bizarre thing about this so-called ‘business decision’ by The Washington Post is that @ishaantharoor’s column flourished on the Internet,” adding that Ishaan Tharoor had “500,000 (half a million plus!) individual subscribers” for his WorldView newsletter. He said he had met foreign ministers, diplomats and scholars around the world who read the newsletter daily, and argued that the newspaper could have tried monetising that reach instead of abolishing it.

title: BCCI | SC grants relief to Anurag Thakur, free to return to cricket administration
content: The Supreme Court has granted relief to former BCCI chief Anurag Thakur, potentially paving his return to cricket administration. The court modified a 2017 order that barred him from BCCI affairs, acknowledging the ban's lengthy duration. This decision follows Thakur's plea for modification, aiming to lift the nine-year restriction.

title: Valentine's week: Best to worst beauty habits for your romantic dates
content: Valentine's Week 2026 celebrations can impact your skin significantly. Skin expert ranks common romantic activities, highlighting that cosy nights in and nourishing meals benefit your complexion. Conversely, late-night parties, excessive alcohol and sugary treats lead to dryness, breakouts and dullness. Prioritising sleep and proper skincare is crucial for maintaining healthy skin amidst the festivities.

title: 'Was fired because my manager was insecure': Employee shares how toxic leadership damages companies
content: A talented content professional was abruptly fired after his manager perceived his viral comedy reel, satirizing corporate life, as a threat. Despite a recent salary hike and strong performance, Ajay Sharma Chinta was forced to resign, highlighting how insecurity and office politics can stifle creativity and lead to talent loss within companies.

title: 'Bharat Taxi' will be rolled out across India in 3 years: Amit Shah at launch
content: Union cooperation minister Amit Shah launched 'Bharat Taxi', India's first cooperative-led ride-hailing platform, after a successful pilot. Initially available in Delhi-NCR and Gujarat, the service aims for nationwide expansion within three years, sharing profits directly with drivers. This indigenous platform offers zero-commission, surge-free pricing and social security benefits for its drivers.

title: The DIY therapy: When mental health advice comes from AI
content: Online symptom checkers and social media are leading many to self-diagnose mental health conditions, often bypassing professional help. This trend, fueled by accessible yet often inaccurate content, risks misdiagnosis, inappropriate self-treatment, and delayed care, especially in regions with limited mental healthcare access. Experts urge caution, emphasizing the complexity of clinical diagnosis.

title: Ghaziabad sisters' suicide: 'Death better than beatings', daughters wrote in diary
content: Three sisters, aged 16, 14, and 12, died after falling from the ninth floor of their Ghaziabad apartment building. A neighbor witnessed the eldest sister on the window ledge with the younger two holding her, before they all fell. Police are investigating, with a diary and mobile phone recovered from the puja room.

title: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha on India match - 'Bangladesh are our brothers'
content: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha reiterated that the decision to skip the India match at the T20 World Cup rests entirely with the Pakistani government. While acknowledging fans will miss the marquee clash, Agha stressed the team’s focus is on the remaining group games.

title: Indian teacher Rouble Nagi, who painted educational murals across slums, wins Global Teacher Prize
content: Indian teacher and activist Rouble Nagi has won the Global Teacher Prize in Dubai for her work establishing over 800 learning centers and creating educational murals in slum areas. Nagi plans to use the $1 million prize to build an institute offering free vocational training to students, continuing her mission to make education accessible.

title: Job scams in UAE/Saudi: How to spot fake offers and agents
content: Gulf job seekers face sophisticated scams, with fraudsters using AI and social media to lure victims. Authorities warn against upfront fees for visas or processing, unverified emails, and unrealistic offers. Always verify job offers through official government channels like MoHRE and MHRSD to avoid falling prey to these deceptive schemes.

title: Epstein files: Not Trump, but this world leader may lose his job
content: The Jeffrey Epstein scandal is creating political pressure for UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer over his past appointment of Peter Mandelson, who is now under criminal investigation.  Meanwhile, US President Donald Trump faces no immediate threat despite his name appearing in Epstein files, highlighting differing political environments and institutional responses to the ongoing global fallout.

title: India-US trade deal: Joint statement in 4–5 days; agreement likely by mid-March, says Goyal
content: India and the US are set to finalize the first tranche of their bilateral trade agreement, with a joint statement expected within days. This deal, under negotiation since early 2025, aims to boost two-way trade to $500 billion by 2030, with India safeguarding sensitive sectors like agriculture and dairy.

title: Gold price today: How much 22K, 24K gold costs in your city? Check rates
content: Precious metals experienced a sharp downturn on Thursday, reversing recent gains as futures faced significant selling pressure. Weak global sentiment and a stronger US dollar contributed to the decline. Silver futures on MCX plunged by 10%, while gold futures also saw a notable drop, erasing previous recovery.

title: Gambhir visits Siddhivinayak, seeks blessings ahead of T20 World Cup
content: Ahead of their T20 World Cup title defense, head coach Gautam Gambhir and batting coach Sitanshu Kotak sought blessings at the Shree Siddhivinayak Temple. India, led by Suryakumar Yadav, enters the tournament as strong favorites, aiming to become the first team to successfully defend the men's T20 World Cup title.

title: 'No such visit took place': MEA rubbishes report claiming Doval–Rubio meet before India-US trade deal
content: The Ministry of External Affairs has firmly denied a Bloomberg report alleging National Security Adviser Ajit Doval met with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio regarding a trade deal. MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal called the claims baseless, stating no such meeting occurred. This rebuttal follows recent announcements of a trade agreement between India and the US.

title: Single spark could cause a fireball: 32-hour op that averted disaster on Pune–Mumbai Expressway
content: A 32-hour hazardous materials operation successfully averted a potential propylene gas disaster on the Pune-Mumbai Expressway. Specialized teams tackled multiple leaks from an overturned tanker carrying 21,000 kg of flammable gas, employing a high-risk decanting strategy and multi-agency coordination to prevent a catastrophic explosion.

title: Man Convicted Of Rape For Fake Payments To Belgium Sex Worker
content: A client who duped a sex worker with fake proof of payment has been convicted of rape in Belgium, in a ruling the Antwerp court of appeal called unprecedented on Thursday.

title: Thief Scales Temple Wall In Madhya Pradesh, Steals Donation Box
content: In the dead of the night, an unidentified man climbed over the wall of a temple in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri, stole the donation box and ran away.

title: 'Rahul Gandhi Called Ravneet Bittu Gaddar Because He Is Sikh": PM Modi's Big Charge
content: Launching a volley against Leader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi over his "traitor" remark against a BJP MP, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said it showed his and the Congress' hatred for the Sikh community.

title: "Standing With Our Jailers": Mamdani Under Fire For Celebratory Hijab Day Post
content: New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani's office posted a celebratory message on World Hijab Day, calling the head covering the "identity and pride" of Muslim women.

title: Mamata Banerjee Says Bengal Interim Budget 'Pro-People' Unlike Union Budget
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said that the interim budget tabled by her government in the assembly is "pro-people" and shows fiscal discipline, "unlike the directionless and rudderless" Union Budget.

title: 'Helping Someone Is Crime': Mother Of Man Attacked For Resisting Harassment
content: "Even helping someone is a crime these days," lamented the mother of a 26-year-old man who was left with severe head injuries after he tried to stop a group of men from harassing women in south Delhi's Mehrauli area.

title: Interim Maintenance Can't Be Denied On Unproven Adultery Claims: Delhi Court
content: The Delhi High Court has refused to interfere with an order granting Rs 26,000 per month as interim maintenance to a woman under the Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act (PWDV Act).

title: Bombay High Court Rejects 1993 Blast Mumbai Convict's Parole Plea
content: The Bombay High Court on Thursday rejected jailed gangster Abu Salem's plea for parole after he expressed inability to pay the police escort charges.

title: Over 3,800 Indians Deported From US In 2025: Centre To Parliament
content: Over 3,800 Indian nationals were deported from the US in 2025, the government informed the Rajya Sabha on Thursday.

title: 16 Labourers Killed, 1 Injured After Blast In Illegal Meghalaya Coal Mine
content: Sixteen labourers died and one was injured after an explosion trapped them deep inside a suspected illegal coal mine at a village in Meghalaya's East Jaintia Hills district on Thursday, police said.

title: The 20 Games, Apps, Characters Ghaziabad Sisters Listed In Chilling Note For Father
content: Three minor sisters allegedly jumped to death from their ninth-floor flat in Ghaziabad on Wednesday. They left behind a diary and a list of their favourite cartoons, characters, and games.

title: Key Parties Contesting Bangladesh Elections 2026
content: With Sheikh Hasina’s Awami League barred from contesting, the political battlefield has opened to new contenders.

title: "Under Them, Deals Meant Bofors": PM's Dig At Congress Over US Pact Criticism
content: Speaking in the Rajya Sabha amid a cacophony by Opposition MPs, Prime Minister Narendra Modi took a dig at Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge and said he could sit and shout slogans, given his age.

title: "Drowned In Liquor": PM Modi's Barb At AAP's Delhi Government In Rajya Sabha
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi slammed Arvind Kejriwal's Aam Aadmi Party today, saying its government in Delhi had "drowned in liquor".

title: Parliament Budget Session Day 4 Live | Congress Has No Ideas, No Vision, No Plan: PM Modi's Big Attack
content: Parliament Budget Session2026 Day 4 Live Updates: PM Modi on Thursday said that India is signing future-ready trade deals with several countries, and that, be it the trade agreement with the EU or the recent deal with the US.

title: "Trinamool Going To Court To Protect Illegal Immigrants": PM Modi Attacks Mamata Banerjee
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has taken a swipe at the Trinamool and its chief Mamata Banerjee over her arguments during the Supreme Court hearing on the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of voter rolls.

title: "India Riding The Reform Express": PM Modi's Top Quotes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is replying to the Motion of Thanks on the President's address on Thursday. He

title: Pentagon Asked To Investigate Elon Musk's SpaceX For Chinese Ownership
content: Democratic US senators on Thursday urged the Pentagon to conduct an immediate review of SpaceX amid allegations that Chinese investors have secretly acquired stakes in the closely held rocket maker, citing potential national security risks.

title: Honeymoon Murder 2.0: Out On Walk, Man Dies In Hit-And-Run Planned By Wife
content: Rajasthan's Honeymoon Murder Case: Ashish and Anju, a newlywed couple from Rajasthan, were out on a walk when a vehicle hit them. While Ashish died on the spot, Anju was robbed of her gold jewellery and left unconscious on the road.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Why Foreign Investors Are Growing Worried About Their 'Minerals' Bets In Pakistan
content: Given that foreign investments require secure supply chains, predictability, and local legitimacy, the crisis in Balochistan is conducive to none of these conditions.

title: Suniel Shetty questions why films talk about Auragzeb, Akbar but not Shivaji Maharaj, Rajputs
content: Suniel Shetty's film 'Kesari Veer' on Somnath Temple's destruction flopped due to poor distribution, not lack of research. Shetty lamented Hindi cinema's focus on invaders over Indian heroes like Shivaji and Rajputs, advocating for broader historical narratives. He stressed the importance of celebrating indigenous culture and heroes, echoing Akshay Kumar's sentiments on historical representation.

title: Mentally ill girl raped, impregnated; 16 rounded up for DNA tests, father turns out to be culprit
content: Mumbai police arrested a father after DNA tests confirmed he impregnated his 20-year-old daughter, who has a mental illness. Hospital staff discovered her five-month pregnancy during a medical examination. The investigation, triggered by the hospital's report, involved DNA comparisons from multiple men, ultimately identifying the father as the sole positive match.

title: Barnwell’s annual Super Bowl opus: We size up every facet of Seahawks-Patriots and pick the winner
content: Can Drake Maye hit enough big plays? Which Sam Darnold will show up? And will defense define this Super Bowl matchup? Let's go deep on Seahawks-Patriots.

title: Sources: Dubs deal Kuminga, Hield for Porzingis
content: The Warriors are trading Jonathan Kuminga and Buddy Hield to the Hawks for Kristaps Porzingis, sources told ESPN, unofficially putting an end to Golden State's pursuit of Giannis Antetokounmpo.

title: Izzo threatens to bench Fears after critical tech
content: Michigan State head coach Tom Izzo called out star guard Jeremy Fears after he was accused of employ dirty tactics for the second straight game, this time earning a critical technical foul in a 76-73 loss to Minnesota.

title: UGA's Seymour charged with damaging property
content: Georgia DT London Seymour, son of Pro Football Hall of Famer Richard Seymour, was arrested Jan. 29 after he and three other men allegedly caused damage to 11 doors in two UGA dormitories on Dec. 5-6.

title: Virus wave delays Finland-Canada hockey opener
content: The Finland women's hockey team had its opening game against Canada postponed due to a stomach virus depleting the roster.

title: NCAA denies appeal for Ole Miss QB Chambliss
content: The NCAA has denied Ole Miss' appeal for Trinidad Chambliss' sixth-year eligibility waiver, which will direct his fight to play college football in 2026 to state court.

title: BYU coach hurt by another anti-Mormon chant
content: BYU coach Kevin Young shared his disappointment over the anti-Mormon chants that could be heard from the Oklahoma State student section during the No. 16 Cougars' upset loss to the Cowboys.

title: Sources: Lonzo to become free agent after trade
content: The Jazz have acquired Lonzo Ball in a three-team trade with the Cavaliers and Hawks but are expected to waive the veteran guard and allow him to become a free agent, sources told ESPN.

title: Portland, led by injured coach, stuns No. 6 Zags
content: Portland pulled off one of the biggest upsets in school history Wednesday night, an 87-80 stunner over No. 6 Gonzaga that came just days after coach Shantay Legans tore his Achilles in practice.

title: ⚾ Olney and Passan's MLB offseason lessons
content: From more outrage over MLB's top spenders to what to make of deals that never happened, here's what we learned this winter.

title: NBA trade buzz: Live updates and intel on deadline day
content: Kristaps Porzingis is headed to the Warriors, and Giannis is not. Catch up on what we're hearing from insiders before the 3 p.m. ET deadline.

title: How Laila Edwards carved her own path as USA Hockey's first Black player
content: Laila Edwards, a standout at Wisconsin, is ready for her Olympic debut as USA Hockey's first Black player.

title: The Faces of the Games: 32 U.S. Olympians to watch
content: On Friday, the 2026 Milan Cortina Olympics will kick off. From Lindsey Vonn to Amber Glenn, here are the athletes you'll want to know.

title: Wetzel: Standing on the brink of anything-goes NCAA eligibility
content: By not controlling who is eligible, the NCAA is losing the ability to function as an organizing athletic body.

title: Power Rankings: Can Texas exact revenge and snap LSU's win streak?
content: The Tigers seek to sweep a key series in the SEC, but the Longhorns look to avenge their loss in Baton Rouge from last month.

title: NHL Awards Watch: Kucherov gaining on MacKinnon for MVP?
content: We polled PHWA voters to find out who's ahead in the major races as some new names have entered the conversation for the Hart and Vezina.

title: Super Bowl LX: Seahawks-Patriots marks latest rematch in big game
content: This year marks the 10th different repeat Super Bowl matchup and the fourth the New England Patriots are involved in themselves.

title: An epic halftime and Manning's farewell: Revisiting Levi's Stadium's last Super Bowl
content: Cam Newton vs. Peyton Manning was among the notable items from the last time the Bay Area hosted the big game.

title: High school stories of 11 Super Bowl stars -- and two coaches
content: Find out what Sam Darnold, Drake Maye, Cooper Kupp, TreVeyon Henderson and others were like before the NFL.

title: Sixty bets for Super Bowl 60
content: We navigated the thousands of bets being offered for Super Bowl LX and narrowed it down to our 60 favorite from 10 different categories.

title: Wrexham have Premier League in sight, just five years after Reynolds and Mac takeover
content: Feb. 9 marks five years since Ryan Reynolds and Rob Mac completed their Wrexham takeover and already, they're on track for promotion to the Premier League.

title: Road to $1M paydays: How WNBA salaries evolved with each CBA
content: For the first time, a $1 million base salary is expected in the new WNBA CBA, and the cap could see a 230% increase.

title: Who you calling old? At the 2026 Olympics, age is just a number
content: Lindsey Vonn, Nick Goepper, Gus Kenworthy and Maddy Schaffrick are in their golden years at the 2026 Olympics. Just don't call them old.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Where all 30 teams stack up ahead of trade deadline
content: Which players are under the most pressure and where all 30 teams rank a day before the Thursday trade deadline.

title: 12 teams that improved their 2026 CFP chances with their roster moves
content: With signing day closing many team's personnel moves, we look at the teams ready to make long postseason runs.

title: Wemby's minutes restriction, KAT's new offensive role, and more
content: A look around the league reveals the latest trends, from Victor Wembanyama's minute restriction to Karl-Anthony Towns' changing offensive role, and more.

title: From Harden and JJJ to Vucevic: Fantasy reaction to the latest NBA trades
content: Andre Snellings and Eric Moody provide fantasy reactions as trades go down leading up to the trade deadline.

title: Men's boxing pound-for-pound rankings: Stevenson moves up, shakes up the top 10
content: Shakur Stevenson's victory over Teofimo Lopez Jr. vaulted him up the list, but just how high did he climb? Here are the latest ESPN pound-for-pound rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Sterling in Napoli talks after ending Chelsea contract
content: Raheem Sterling is in talks to join Napoli, while Barcelona and Real Madrid eye Tottenham's Cristian Romero. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Koil Alwar Tirumanjanam performed at Srinivasa Mangapuram
content: The purificatory ritual precedes the annual nine-day Brahmotsavams at the TTD’s Sri Kalyana Venkateswara Swamy temple commencing February 8

title: CM set to open BioAsia on Feb. 17; Telangana Rising Vision to be showcased
content: Union Ministers, global pharma leaders scheduled to participate in the 2-day life sciences and health-tech forum

title: A.P. High Court adjourns Ambati Rambabu’s lunch motion petition to February 11
content: It prays for quashing the cases registered against him for allegedly making abusive comments on the Chief Minister

title: Guidelines issued for Circular Economy and Waste Recycling Policy
content: They seek to frame actionable procedures, standards and templates for all the stakeholders to tackle critical environmental challenges arising in the industrial waste landscape

title: PM ‘hiding behind’ Speaker; claims of threat an ‘absolute lie,’ says Congress
content: Party’s reaction comes after Speaker says he asked the PM not to come to the House following information that some Congress MPs could carry out an ‘unexpected act’ near his seat

title: Central Kerala LDF rally led by Jose K. Mani to begin on Friday
content: Organisers say the rally aims at showcasing the development initiatives and social welfare programmes initiated by LDF government

title: Devotee-couple bring oxygen cylinder for darshan at Mayakka Devi Temple in Chinchali
content: It has been proven many a time that devotion can make people indulge in acts that look difficult and defy logic

title: TDB aims to tackle pollution in Pampa ahead of next Sabarimala pilgrimage season
content: Campaign will be rolled out in April in all south Indian States using press meets, social media, newspaper and TV, and FM radio to crack down on the practice of pilgrims discarding clothes in the river. Three truckloads of abandoned clothes were removed in the final round of cleaning after the season this  year

title: Road Safety Cadet programme to foster safe road culture among students
content: State-level inauguration of programme will be held at Mavelikkara this month, say Minister for General Education and Transport

title: 48,000 trees mapped as Mysuru rolls out city-wide tree audit
content: Of the 65 wards under the Mysuru City Corporation, surveys are currently underway in 37 wards, with more than 48,000 trees already documented

title: SFI demands government takeover of Mohan Babu University in A.P.
content: A roundtable seeks withdrawal of alleged false cases filed against student leaders and refund of ₹26.17 crore to students as recommended by the APSCHE

title: BJP Yuva Morcha seeks probe into ‘irregularities’ in Gulbarga University
content: Members of the Kalaburagi district unit submit a memorandum to the Vice-Chancellor of the university containing their various demands

title: Collector submits report on title distribution in catchment areas of dams in Idukki
content: Report recommends granting title deeds to farmers residing above the full reservoir level of the dams

title: Getting education is women’s real source of strength, says panel chief
content: She was speaking at a programme for college students organised at the auditorium of the district administration building in Koppal

title: Gauhati High Court urged to take note of Assam CM’s ‘hate speech’
content: Citizens who submitted a memorandum to Gauhati HC included academician Hiren Gohain, retired Director General of Police Harekrishna Deka, former Archbishop of Guwahati Thomas Menamparampil, MP Ajit Kumar Bhuyan, and environmental scientist Dulal Chandra Goswami

title: BMRCL announces zone-wise fare revision from February 9
content: Under the new revision, fares will increase by a minimum of ₹1 and a maximum of ₹5 across 10 fare zones on the entire metro network, which currently spans 96.10 km

title: Kumaraswamy’s overtures on return to State politics create a flutter in NDA alliance
content: Kumaraswamy and his party leaders will not have made open statements without ‘tacit blessings’ of BJP central leadership, says a senior leader

title: SUEZ to take over Kochi Corporation’s water supply distribution system from February 27
content: The company had signed an agreement with the KWA last year to optimise water distribution in Kochi. The ₹1,141.28-crore project is being funded by the Asian Development Bank

title: No plan to close down Ernakulam loco shed, facility will be upgraded for electric engines, says Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Union Railway Minister says facility continues to be crucial to operational requirements of Thiruvananthapuram and Palakkad rail divisions

title: SFI, PAAP demand strict action against MBU
content: Urge the government to ensure the university returns ₹27 crore that was illegally collected from the students, and cases be registered against Mohan Babu and his followers for fraud

title: DAC to consider Rafale acquisition ahead of Macron visit
content: Defence Acquisition Council to take up big-ticket defence deals, with Rafale fighter aircraft proposal in focus

title: BMRCL to install 500 elevators, 1,000 escalators across metro stations to enhance smooth commuter movement
content: The Namma Metro network, which currently spans about 96 km with 83 stations, is set to expand to nearly 175 km with around 127 stations over the next two years

title: Watch: Beaten to death for nothing: Truth behind Ajith Kumar’s custodial killing | Focus Tamil Nadu
content: Seven months after a young man died in illegal custody after being picked up and tortured by the Tamil Nadu police on a mere suspicion of stealing jewels, a chilling truth has emerged. The CBI has told the Madras High Court that the alleged theft never occurred. If there was no crime, why did he have to die?

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: 74 ‘host institutes’ approved in Andhra Pradesh under MSME Innovative Scheme
content: The primary objective of the scheme is to reduce the compliance burden on the MSMEs, for which several initiatives have been launched, says Union Minister Shobha Karandlaje

title: Three sentenced to three years in jail for harassing minor girl
content: The three kept following the minor girl and harassed her making vulgar comments, according to a complaint from the victim’s parents

title: Vijayawada bypass project will be completed by March-end, says Union Minister Nitin Gadkari
content: The six-lane, 30-km road from Chinna Avutupalli to Gollapudi is a part of the Vijayawada-Gundugolanu section of NH-16 in the Kolkata-Chennai corridor

title: Two books on Vachana literature to be released in Hubballi on Sunday
content: Vachanasahitya Mandara Foundation is organising the event at Anubhava Mantapa, Veeramma Farm House, near railway bridge, on Gadag Road

title: AP Chambers submits pre-budget suggestions to Finance Minister Payyavula Keshav
content: Major suggestions include a dedicated escrow account mechanism for disbursing industrial incentives and one-time VAT dispute resolution scheme to unlock blocked capital

title: Jayalalithaa’s residence Veda Nilayam will be auctioned if tax dues not paid: I-T department tells Madras HC
content: The department makes the submission in response to a writ petition filed by her niece J. Deepa challenging the demand for income tax and wealth tax arrears

title: February 25 last date to apply for new private unaided junior colleges in Andhra Pradesh
content: BIE invites online applications for the academic year 2026–27 for establishment of 32 colleges in 26 identified mandals and six colleges in two municipal areas

title: World confident of stability after India's trade deals with EU, U.S., says PM Modi
content: “India is signing future-ready trade deals with several nations. In the last few days, we have signed trade deals with nine big nations, including the 'mother of all deals' with the 27-nation bloc of the European Union,” PM Modi said

title: At least 16 labourers killed in blast at illegal coal mine in Meghalaya; several feared trapped
content: The police have sought assistance from the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) to carry out rescue operations at the site. "The SDRF team are yet to come," says Superintendent of Police Vikash Kumar

title: T20 World Cup boycott row: India ready to face Pakistan, says Captain Suryakumar Yadav
content: “ICC has given the fixture. Our flight is booked and we are going there (to Colombo),” says Suryakumar

title: Himachal Pradesh CM announces ban on mobile phones in all schools from March 1
content: CM Sukhu gave details on strict enforcement measures, stating that any student found in possession of a phone would face a fine of ₹500 and the confiscation of the device

title: Shivalinge Gowda blames BJP for provoking him to speak rudely, regrets  remarks
content: Congress legislator Gowda’s apology comes a day after he allegedly remarked BJP MLA Sharanu Salgar looted money through his wife

title: Watch: What are the Epstein files and why has this triggered a political controversy in India?
content: On January 30, the U.S. Department of Justice released over three million pages of documents related to the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein’s sexual abuse network and his associates. The newly released files mention several high-profile global figures. The disclosures triggered political controversy in India after some records appeared to reference individuals allegedly close to Prime Minister Narendra Modi in messages exchanged with the disgraced American financier. Who is Jeffrey Epstein and what are the Epstein Files?

title: When Madras Checks meet African memory: inside the Siddi women’s kavand quilt tradition
content: Threads of Confluence, a travelling exhibition, stitches the story of African migration to India with an Indian fabric that went to Africa and beyond

title: Five Tejas jets ready for delivery to IAF: HAL
content: The Indian Air Force is looking at inducting the warplanes as the number of its fighter squadrons have gone down to 30 from officially sanctioned strength of 42.

title: Five-day work week for Kerala govt. employees: online meeting on Friday
content: Service organisations have reserved their reactions in apprehension that the new work pattern will eventually affect their current entitlements, including the number of public holidays and the leave they are entitled to

title: ‘Aashaan’ movie review: A patchily-written ode to cinema and strugglers
content: ‘Aashaan’, unfolding through a film-within-a-film structure, certainly comes from someone who understands the struggle of making it, but that very passion also results in the film packing in far more than it needs to

title: Agreement signed on creation of Frontier Nagaland Territorial Authority
content: The tripartite agreement was signed in the presence of Nagaland CM Nephiu Rio, by MHA, the Nagaland Government, and the Eastern Nagaland Peoples’ Organisation (ENPO)

title: Vizhinjam port sets new operational benchmarks in January, 2026
content: Port registers its highest monthly container throughput of 1,23,092 Twenty-foot Equivalent Units in January. It handles 62 vessels, the maximum processed in a single month since operations began

title: Union Minister Amit Shah launches Bharat Taxi, first cooperative-led ride-hailing platform
content: "In three years, Bharat Taxi will be rolled out across the country, from Kashmir to Kanniyakumari and Dwarka to Kamakhya," Cooperation Minister Amit Shah said

title: Time to reopen closed tourist spots in J&K, will discuss with Shah: CM Abdullah
content: I believe the time has now come to reopen them. From the government's side, discussions with the Government of India on this issue are ongoing, says J&K CM Omar Abdullah
